resources.string: Paintings of which artists did you see in this quiz?
Can You Name These Famous Works Of Art?
Only 9% of the entire population knows all of these works of art!
The Swirls in the Night Sky
The Victorian Farmer and His Wife
Self-Portrait with Thorn Necklace and Hummingbird
The Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci is the most well-known work of art in history, and has been at the Louvre Museum in Paris since 1797.
The Starry Night by Vincent van Gogh was inspired by the painter is view in his asylum. It is on permanent collection at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.

Girl with a Pearl Earring by Johannes Vermeer is on display at the Mauritshuis in Holland. The painting was the subject of a historical fiction book called Girl with a Pearl Earring which was later turned into a movie starring Scarlett Johansson.
The Last Supper by Leonardo da Vinci is a mural painting that can be seen at the refectory at the Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie in Milan, Italy.
There are four versions of The Scream by Edvard Munch: two painted and two pastel versions.
American Gothic by Grant Wood is one of the most parodied paintings in history.
This surrealist painting by Salvador Dali was inspired after the painter watched cheese melting in the sun. It is currently displayed at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.
The Creation of Adam is part of the fresco by Michelangelo and can be seen on the ceiling at the Sistine Chapel.

This painting by Frida Kahlo is one of her most well-known self-portraits. She painted it after her divorce from fellow painter Diego Rivera. It is on display at the Harry Ransom Center at the University of Texas at Austin.
Vincent van Gogh is Self-portrait without beard may have been the painter is last self-portrait before he killed himself.
